posts.content:
Two souls, The Judges

This is another of my "madness and disability" builds, this one has DID.

Erkur and Tyrvodat, in the mind of Two Souls

I apologize for my frenglish

Backstory :

Erkur Briskshield is a strange and lonely Gnome. He lives alone in an ancestral forest ruled by Dragons and Giants. He's an hermit, an anachoret, dedicated to an old draconic God named Lendys, the god of harsh Justice. The draconic God has allowed him to embody his Justice since the little guy is one of the wisest and smartest creature of the Realms...

During his childhood, Erkur was a very lonesome child, a smart weirdo, with strange habits, somewhere "on the spectrum". Other children bullied him, beat him, everyday during his childhood. The violence was also at his home, his parents were very harsh, violent. 
To cope, the soul of Erkur divided into two souls (in our world, we don't explain that by magic, we call this phenomenon Dissociative Identity Disorder), the first was still Erkur, the second one was a female dragon named Tyrvodat, traped in a little gnomish body.

During their early adulthood, Two Souls were obsessed by draconic Lore, and they studied draconic secrets to help Tyrvodat to get a true Dragon body one day. They decided to embrace the Faith of Lendys, and to became  living avatars of Justice in the Realms. 
Later, the magical and the draconic knowledges of Two Souls became surnatural, and Tyrvodat gained the power to become a powerful green acid Dragon, enpowered with powerful damage shields and tough as an Immortal Judge.

Two souls now rules the Realms to punish the bad. He bait them as Erkur the little Gnome, a rich disabled Gnome who lose his mind, and then Tyrvodat appears and dissolve them while they're trying to beat him. When a good guy help The Judges, they offer a part of their wisdom and gold treasure to the benefactor.


Explanations :

This is I think a really more playable version of Spellfang, playable as a damage shield mage (damage shield, buffs, no save spells, wands, scrolls) until the draconic shape.
If you want to play a lazy and more playable damage shield build, more optimal, play Grizz's build Mestil's Half-Dead Juggernaut. Two souls is also a powerful build, but less playable (you can't cast except epic spells while in Dragon, you're not so tough in early levels), it's made for RP pleasure, but it's not just for RP, as every dragon build, if you're patient, you're rewarded.

After dragon shape, cast your buffs and damage shields and go dragon. You will crush every meleer. Your fort saves are high for dev criters.  Against wizards, use you're no saves spells (IGMS), or try melee as a dragon (you're bad at it, but bad as a dragon, that's enough to kick a wizard).
If you have to recast your buffs and damage shield, cast Epic Warding as a Dragon, then unshape, cast your buffs etc., then reshape.
Stay Flat Footed against meleer, to loose 33 AC and always apply your damage shields.

Concentration skill is about between 55 and 65 (buffed), so you're untauntable as a dragon, and very hard to taunt as a Gnome (concentration between 47 and 53).

Items : 
In gnome form : constitution items. Before Dragon transformation : + constitution armor shield and helmet, + energy resistance (if you choose green dragon, choose other energy resistances than acid for exemple).

Pros : Draconic DR and HP (+1000 buffed) + Damages Shields are awesome. Pleasure to play a dragon entity with full wizard spellbook. Being a Gnome AND a Dragon is badass. Versatility, able to cast lot of spells and to create wands and scrolls. 

Cons : a bit hard to play at low lewels, but not so hard if you know how to play a non pure wizard. No crit immune. Can't cast all the time, but not an issue if you know of to play this build with high spell durations.
